We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
The Embedded Systems Team develops the first layers of software on the car, from interfacing with hardware, to moving large amounts of data up the stack. We are looking for a talented Systems Test Engineering Manager to lead, manage, and grow an engineering team in a fast-paced environment. This is a unique opportunity to own and define how the embedded systems of an autonomous vehicle are tested and what it takes to get the driver out of the vehicle, safely and at scale. At Cruise, we believe in managers who remain deeply technical and understand the challenges their teams are facing. Our managers coach their teams to success, shield their teams from distractions, and help publicly celebrate wins.
What you'll be doing:
Define testing and verification plans for the embedded software that enable Cruise vehicles.
Work side by side with development managers to release high quality features with extensive regression testing. 
Work with Engineering Director(s) and Technical Program Managers to create and execute on a roadmap for your team
Drive software test engineering best practices within your team.
Conduct performance reviews, identify top performers, and support their growth into Technical Leadership or Engineering Management roles
Foster a healthy, collaborative culture and high-output team
Help define, build, and embody Cruise engineering culture and principles
Invest heavily in recruiting by working closely with recruiters, screening candidates, and identifying opportunities for external engagement to improve the Cruise engineering brand
What you must have:
4+ years experience managing teams who have shipped and support scalable production systems.
Test-minded; has a unique ability to break things
Experience defining test automation strategies and driving its execution.
Extensive experience building test plans, regression testing, and root cause analysis.
Self motivated to lead your teams, encourage best practices, and constantly improve.
Effective interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills.
Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent real world experience.
Bonus points!
Experience building teams from the ground up
Experience with Python
Experience with embedded Linux systems
Experience with Hardware in the Loop testing
Experience with safety critical applications (medical devices, aviation, or automotive)
Familiar with C and C++
Why Cruise?

Competitive salary and benefits 
401(k) Cruise matching program 
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life

Healthy meals and snacks provided

Monthly wellness stipend
Commuter benefits

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
Our Perception engineering group at Cruise develops deep learning based approaches for 3D object detection, tracking, semantic segmentation, classification and understanding all the objects around a vehicle. Enabling our vehicles to understand the world is critical to our mission and ability to deploy at scale. Our fleet of vehicles provides robust data sets that you can leverage to prototype radically new models and push novel solutions into production.
The Engineering Manager will lead the growth and organization of the team, mentor engineers and support career development, work with other Engineering Managers and Technical Leads on design decisions and code review, and communicate team status and objectives with senior management across Cruise.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.

Invest heavily in recruiting, identifying opportunities for external engagement to improve the Cruise engineering brand

Embody Cruise behaviors: Stay Safe, Own It, Stay Focused, Seek Truth, Work Together, Be Humble

Prior experience managing, leading, and growing teams
Proven track record of shipping production-quality software for mission-critical or complex software products

Experience managing a team and initiatives in a mission-critical and fast-paced Machine Learning engineering organization
Track record of driving ML research projects from start to completion, including conception, problem definition, experimentation, iteration, and finally publication or productization
Experience developing deep learning and novel computer vision solutions

Msc or Phd in Computer Vision, machine learning or a related field.

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.

Prediction Teams at Cruise are responsible for developing machine learning models to create a probabilistic representation of the world surrounding our vehicles to safely and effectively maneuver them around cities. Moreover, the team you build and grow will solve exciting challenges around what different agents (like other cars, buses, animals, pedestrians) are going to do in the next few seconds, their future paths, and how all those elements and more affect one another. About the role: 
  We are looking for talented Engineering Managers to lead, manage, and grow highly effective engineering teams across the Autonomous Vehicle Engineering organization. At Cruise, we believe in managers who remain deeply technical, and understand the challenges their teams are facing, even though they may not be contributing code day to day. Our managers coach their teams to success, shield their teams from distractions, and help publicly celebrate wins.
  Day-to-day responsibilities include:
Lead and grow a team of engineers within Autonomous Vehicle Engineering 
Ensure high-functioning, high-output team delivers high quality engineering architecture and design along with fast, reliable, testable production code
Coach and support Individual Contributors enabling effective cross-collaboration between feature and project teams
Conduct performance reviews, identify top performers, and support their growth into Engineering Management or Technical Leadership roles
Help define, build, and embody Cruise engineering culture and principles
Invest heavily in recruiting by working closely with recruiters, engaging candidates, and identifying opportunities for external engagement to improve the Cruise engineering brand
Act as a sounding board and technical architect for your teams, help define technical vision and strategy, and ensure the technical direction of your teams aligns with other teams across the company
You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
Previous experience as an engineering Manager or Tech Lead providing day-to-day guidance to software engineers
Proven track record of shipping production quality software for mission-critical or complex software products
Previous (8+ years) experience as a software engineer delivering results within large-scale, robotics, or safety-critical project environments
Experience managing projects across multiple teams
Experience managing, mentoring, and coaching engineers
Self motivation and passion to lead your teams, encourage best practices, and constantly improve
Demonstrated ability to understand and set the architectural direction of pre-existing large-scale C++ software projects spanning multiple teams and years of active, intensive development
A track record of successfully planning and executing on strategic investments in technical debt and refactoring of legacy systems with a focus on accelerating the overall delivery pace of an organization
Can manage trade-offs between investing in immediate engineering excellence, funding incremental improvements, and delivering business value to an existing system vs. “green-field” development
Bonus points!
Familiarity with functional programming and experience applying functional concepts to production-scale C++ software engineering (e.g. immutable data structures and separating execution from algorithmic description), especially as it applies to writing understandable, high-performance code.
Experience in runtime performance optimization, including optimizing memory access patterns, exploiting cache locality, loop unrolling, vectorization, and minimizing kernel/system overhead.
Perks of being a Cruiser:
While doing meaningful work is the best perk of all, we also offer the following programs and benefits to support the extraordinary humans who serve as the backbone in making our robot cars go:
The opportunity to solve difficult problems that have immediate and valuable real-world applications
Competitive salary and benefits including 401k Cruise matching program to help you meet your long-term financial goals
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
Paid parental leave so you can spend time with the newest addition(s) to your family’s fleet
Health and Wellness reimbursement
Annual Learning and Development stipend
Flexible vacation and 10 paid company holidays
State of the art equipment for your work station
Healthy lunch, dinner, and snacks

We're the driverless car company.
We believe in improving people’s lives by making transportation safer, more accessible, and more convenient. We’re building the world’s most advanced software to fuel the driverless cars that safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about.
We seek and embrace diversity in all of its forms. We continuously push ourselves to think differently and take ownership wherever it's needed. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed. If you share our passion for achieving what some say is impossible, join us.
About the role: 
Cruise is looking for a Strategy and Operations Manager to be based within our Cruise Robotics department, working directly with key Engineering leaders, cross functional Engineering partners, and Recruiting.  The successful candidate will oversee strategic initiatives, helping to execute against pivotal programs, within tight timeframes. Working as a cross-functional leader, this role will be working with all business units throughout Cruise in documenting procedures, managing programs from inception to launch, and ensuring success of cross collaborative efforts between business units.
Day-to-day responsibilities include:
Manage day-to-day operations processes of key Robotics teams, meeting deadlines, and ensuring that projects are being completed on schedule.
Successfully follow through on strategy on short and long-term department goals, which will be developed directly with the VP of Robotics.
Use data to monitor, track, and evaluate KPIs; proactively propose and champion process, tooling, or documentation.
Communicate across different groups within engineering, operations, legal, vehicles, and support teams to understand needs and align on priorities.
Work with senior leadership on creation of new processes and documentation.
Be the go-to program manager for all things operations related to Robotics, cross functional Engineering partners, and Recruiting
Identify, refine and develop team goals, and ensure the team is tracking to achieve those goals.
Communicate priorities, activities, and results to the larger organization, while ensuring deliverables are met. Have a strong pulse and feedback loop on organizational needs.
Bring your past experiences to the role and will use your unique perspective to help us think creatively about how to approach many of the biggest challenges and opportunities
Partner with teams to help them execute on important strategic initiatives or drive operational scale and efficiency.
Lead other scaling projects for Operations that require you to build a data-driven strategy, determine a game plan and operationally execute, understand and resolve organizational alignment challenges, and effectively communicate progress to a broad audience of stakeholders
Implement scalable initiatives and best practices to ensure a world-class operation
You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
Ability to drive forward solutions in ambiguous situations with limited supervision.
Ability to evaluate organizational structures and processes and implement measurable improvements through targeted change initiatives.
5+ years of work experience, ideally at a fast-growing company.
Ability to understand and communicate basic technical concepts.
Organized, structured thinker that can navigate different projects, tools, and stakeholders and communicate status, progress, issues, and changes to diverse audiences.
Analytical and data-oriented; can create and use KPIs / dashboards to monitor complex operations.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Passionate about autonomous technology and its potential impact on the world.
Proficient in Excel and Powerpoint.
Perks of being a Cruiser:
While doing meaningful work is the best perk of all, we also offer the following programs and benefits to support the extraordinary humans who serve as the backbone in making our robot cars go:
The opportunity to solve difficult problems that have immediate and valuable real-world applications
Competitive salary and benefits including 401k Cruise matching program to help you meet your long-term financial goals
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
Paid parental leave so you can spend time with the newest addition(s) to your family’s fleet
Health and Wellness reimbursement

Flexible vacation and 10 paid company holidays
State of the art equipment for your work station
Healthy breakfast, lunch, and snacks

Senior 3D Artist
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
  We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.

  If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us. 
  What you’ll be doing:
Model and texture highly realistic 3D vehicles, hard surface objects, vegetation, environment set pieces, and characters for our Unreal Engine based simulation.
Assist with outsourcing and communication with external art teams. Gather references and write asset briefs, review and provide feedback for incoming assets, and integrate content into the engine.

Highly technical self-starter with the ability to learn and adopt complex workflows and non-standard content creation processes.
Online portfolio, with examples of vehicles, props, characters, foliage, and environments with a detailed breakdown of your contributions for each piece.

Experience lighting 3D environments using both baked and fully dynamic lighting systems.
Knowledge of Houdini and procedurally created content pipelines.
Experience modeling modular vehicles and buildings.

job-title: Senior Applied Research Scientist, Computer Vision
job-description:
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
Cruisers have the opportunity to define new ways of working and learn from world-class leaders in their field. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to play a part in making a positive impact in the world by advancing the revolutionary work of self-driving cars, join us.
What you'll be doing:
As a Senior Applied Research Scientist - Computer Vision, you drive the research projects that address the everyday challenges that happen on urban roads, ones that do not have standard solutions available. On a day-to-day basis, you will:
Formulate problems
Propose, prototype, evaluate, and iterate solutions
Support productizing and deploying solutions to robot cars
Initiate and lead new projects
Invent pragmatic long term and stable software solutions to complex problems
Champion engineering excellence, coming up with solutions not just identifying problems
What you must have:
PhD / MS degree in computer vision, machine learning or a related field with multiple research publications in top conferences or journals; alternatively equivalent years of industry experience solving CV problems which do not have readily-available solutions
Expertise in at least one of these specific areas: 2D/3D object detection, semantic / instance segmentation, fine-grained attribute understanding, human pose / gesture recognition, image sequence / semantics understanding, image embedding, visual/LIDAR-based tracking, multi-object tracking, and vision-based behavior prediction
Track record of driving ML research projects from start to completion, including conception, problem definition, experimentation, iteration, and finally publication or productization
Strong programming skills in Python and/or C++
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Bonus Points!
PhD in machine learning, computer vision, or robotics vision
Experience using deep-learning frameworks, e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc

job-title: Senior Applied Research Scientist - Machine Learning
job-description:
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
The Autonomous Vehicle (AV) software stack heavily relies on machine learning. Throughout the lifecycle of each machine learning model, skilled ML engineers work closely to design, build, train, and deploy machine learning models into our unique AV systems. In this position, you will work closely with machine learning engineers from different AV Engineering teams (e.g. Computer Vision, Prediction), covering different algorithms across the AV software stack. If you're interested in solving some of the most exciting machine learning problems in the industry, then chat with us!
What you'll be doing:
Research, design, and develop new machine learning solutions and algorithms.
Drive high level algorithm decisions to ensure fast and accurate machine learning in a multitude of different applications
Implement cutting edge machine learning techniques in object classification, labelling, pose estimation, and prediction
Use real-time state estimation and context from surroundings to predict the motion of surrounding vehicles and pedestrians for use with vehicle path planning
Work on data association, clustering, segmentation, filtering, and estimation
Build robust, reliable systems to handle common and uncommon situations on the road
What you must have:
PhD or MS in CS/CE/EE, or equivalent industry experience
Extensive experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow, Caffe, and PyTorch
Experience with machine learning and classification
Strong programming skills in Python or C++
Excellent mathematical reasoning skills, especially with probability 
Passionate about self driving car technology and its impact on the world
Track record of driving ML research projects from start to completion, including conception, problem definition, experimentation, iteration, and finally publication or productization
Bonus points!
Experience with Hidden Markov Models (HMMs)
Experience with ROS, OpenCV, Gazebo, or PCL
Experience with CUDA
Experience in deploying perception algorithms into real world environments

job-title: Senior Engineering Manager - Embedded Systems, ES Platform
job-description:
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
The Embedded Systems Team develops the first layers of software on the car, from interfacing with hardware, to moving large amounts of data into the software stack.  We are looking for a talented Senior Engineering Manager to lead, manage, and grow engineering teams in a fast-paced environment focused on our Embedded OS and FPGA / SoC teams. At Cruise, we believe in managers who remain deeply technical and understand the challenges their teams are facing, even though they may not be the technical lead or contributing software day-to-day. Our managers coach their teams to success, shield their teams from distractions, and help publicly celebrate wins.
What you'll be doing:
Lead and grow a team of first line engineering managers within the Embedded Systems team
Ensure teams deliver high quality production code that is safe, well architected, fast, reliable, and testable.
Work with Engineering Managers and Tech Leads to set and communicate technical direction and product strategies while anticipating strategic and scaling challenges.
Work with teams across Cruise to foster a collaborative culture of testing, safety, and documentation
Work with your team, Technical Project Managers and external stakeholders to build, prioritize and execute against an engineering roadmap
Conduct performance reviews, identify top performers, and support their growth into Technical Leadership or Engineering Management roles
Embody Cruise behaviors: Stay Safe, Own It, Stay Focused, Seek Truth, Work Together, Be Humble
What you must have:
7+ years experience managing teams who have shipped and support production systems
10+ years experience as a software engineer delivering results within large-scale, robotics, or safety-critical project environments
Self-motivated to lead your teams, encourage best practices, and constantly improve
Effective interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills
Experience managing multiple teams and initiatives in a mission-critical and fast-paced engineering organization
Successfully grown software engineering teams by growing engineering managers and driving external leadership recruiting
Bonus points!
Experience building or managing performance and safety critical systems or similar
Experience delivering complex, distributed systems
Experience with DO-178, ISO-26262, or IEC-62304
Experience working with Embedded Linux on a multiple platforms
Experience working with FPGAs or novel silicon platforms
Exposure to verifying and validating safety critical software and systems 
Strategic, collaborative, and execution-focused

The Maneuver Planning Senior Engineering Manager is accountable for strategy and execution of the maneuver planning teams. Maneuver planning is responsible for consuming inputs from Prediction, Localization, Mapping, Routing, etc., and computing real-time maneuver decisions and high level trajectories. This role includes setting high level technical direction by working with Technical Product Managers to build project roadmaps, prioritize work and execute against those plans. This also includes building a world class engineering organization capable of scaling as the company grows; this includes mentoring and growing strong engineering managers.
What you'll be doing:
Lead and grow a team of 3+ robotics software engineering teams 
Work with your team, Technical Project Managers and external stakeholders to build, prioritize and execute against an engineering roadmap
Guide the team to create a technical direction and execution plan to solve ambiguous autonomous vehicle problems

Embody Cruise behaviors: Stay Safe, Own It, Stay Focused, Seek Truth, Work Together, Be Humble

Managed multiple teams and initiatives in a fast-paced engineering organization on the company critical path

Self motivation to proactively lead your team to deliver high quality and value software

Domain experience in path planning, optimization, control theory, graph theory, machine learning and the like 
Contributing production quality C++ software at scale 
Exposure to verifying and validating safety critical software and systems 
Experience developing autonomous vehicles

Remarkably organized and have a keen eye for even the most minute details 
A proven self-starter that has the ability to troubleshoot and resolve roadblocks as they occur
Adaptable-- able to shift gears at a moment's notice!
A genuine people-person, balancing the right amount of friendliness and professionalism

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us. 
About the role:
We are looking for an experienced Fleet Safety Engineer to join our Product Safety team in ensuring the safety of our autonomous vehicle fleet testng and operations.  As part of the Product Safety department at Cruise, the Fleet Safety Engineer will support day-to-day fleet operations safety and major company initiatives by providing technical system-level safety assessments and ensuring hazards are identified and mitigated early in the design and implementation process. 
In this position, you will collaborate with teams across Engineering, Operations, Product Safety, Security, and Legal to build and execute on a world-class systems safety risk management process in line with our company’s overall commitment to creating a safer world through autonomous vehicles.
If you're interested in how to incorporate safety in the early stages of design and enable cutting edge technology development while making the world a better place, let's chat!
What you’ll be doing:
Act as technical member of the operational safety team supporting system safety analysis, hazard identification and mitigation efforts
Perform safety analyses for software, hardware, and operational changes to identify whether factors can contribute to a hazard for the fleet and work with engineering and operations teams to identify safer solutions
Serve as the operational safety expert for fleet safety on major company projects and programs. Architect approach to safety assessment and validation of human-machine interface aspects.  This includes review and input to both engineering designs and operational plans to ensure overall system safety.
Participate in design reviews and discussions to help ensure that safety goals and requirements are being effectively addressed
Work with the Technical Operations team - to identify critical maintenance to keep the fleet running safely
Develop operational safety requirements working collaboratively with engineering and operations teams.
Ensure bi-directional traceability between operational safety requirements and system hazards including a validation process to close the loop on safety controls implementation verification
Support ops response team to analyze field data including incidents to identify risk trends and areas of safety improvement
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the Cruise’s safety program including creation and iteration of fleet risk assessment standards and tools 
Participate in program audits to ensure effective operational safety controls implementation
Promote safety culture at Cruise
What you must have:
5+ years of relevant engineering work experience that includes System Safety engineering
Familiarity with Systems Theoretic Process Analysis (STPA), Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), Functional Hazard Analysis (FHA), Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA), and System Safety Hazard Analysis (SHA).
Experience identifying safety hazards and developing studies in human-machine interface
Detail oriented with excellent analytical skills and problem resolution skills
Team player with excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Self-motivated. Agile, flexible, and adaptable to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and matrixed team environment.
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or related scientific field
Bonus Points!
An advanced degree in engineering or related technical fields
Expertise in safety analysis for autonomous vehicles 
Experience in evaluating and ensuring regulatory compliance
Why Cruise?
Our benefits are here to support the whole you:
Competitive salary and benefits 
401(k) Cruise matching program

Healthy meals and snacks provided

Perform safety analyses for software, hardware, and operational changes to identify whether factors can contribute to a hazard for the fleet and work with engineering and operations teams to identify safer solutions
Serve as the operational safety expert for fleet safety on major company projects and programs. Architect approach to safety assessment and validation of human-machine interface aspects.  This includes review and input to both engineering designs and operational plans to ensure overall system safety.
Participate in design reviews and discussions to help ensure that safety goals and requirements are being effectively addressed
Work with the Technical Operations team - to identify critical maintenance to keep the fleet running safely
Develop operational safety requirements working collaboratively with engineering and operations teams.
Ensure bi-directional traceability between operational safety requirements and system hazards including a validation process to close the loop on safety controls implementation verification
Support ops response team to analyze field data including incidents to identify risk trends and areas of safety improvement
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the Cruise’s safety program including creation and iteration of fleet risk assessment standards and tools 
Participate in program audits to ensure effective operational safety controls implementation
Promote safety culture at Cruise
What you must have:
5+ years of relevant engineering work experience that includes System Safety engineering
Familiarity with Systems Theoretic Process Analysis (STPA), Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), Functional Hazard Analysis (FHA), Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA), and System Safety Hazard Analysis (SHA).
Experience identifying safety hazards and developing studies in human-machine interface
Detail oriented with excellent analytical skills and problem resolution skills
Team player with excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Self-motivated. Agile, flexible, and adaptable to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and matrixed team environment.
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or related scientific field
Bonus Points!
An advanced degree in engineering or related technical fields
Expertise in safety analysis for autonomous vehicles 
Experience in evaluating and ensuring regulatory compliance

We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.

About the role:
We are looking for a talented Senior Frontend Engineer to design and implement frontend technologies to build and manage one of the largest labeled datasets in the self-driving industry.
Our Ground Truth team builds data pipelines to ingest and label ground truth data used by our Computer Vision & Perception teams, scalable web-based tooling used by our on-site and remote labeling teams, monitoring systems to measure the performance of our labeling teams, and analysis systems to track and constantly improve the quality and accuracy of our data sets.
What you'll be doing:
Design and implement web-based systems to annotate multidimensional, multimodal time series data and produce ML ground truth by leveraging both human and machine intelligence.
Build automation features for the labeling workflows to improve labeling efficiency and quality.
Build frontends to provide operational insight into real-time data.
Build a platform that is intuitive to use and new features that are easy to learn.
Work closely with machine learning engineers to enable R&D efforts and improve existing systems.
Drive best practices in our React & Redux based applications.
What you must have:
At least 5+ years of experience building modern frontends using React, Redux, WebGL and similar libraries.
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, or equivalent real-world experience.
Strong understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript, ES6+, and dynamic frontend fundamentals.
Experience working with backend REST APIs and websockets.
Passionate about self-driving technology and its potential impact on the world.
Bonus points! 
Experience building interactive tools that are core to people’s daily work.
Experience with three.js or related 3D rendering technologies.
Experience working with Docker development and deployment workflows.

The FPGA / SoC team is responsible for all FPGA development at Cruise, as well as the low level software that interfaces to it. As a Hardware / Software Co-Design Engineer, you’ll work with sensor interfacing, signal processing and high-speed data movement for our current and next generation of autonomous vehicles. You’ll work on the latest generation of FPGA / SoC silicon across both sides of the hardware / software boundary, enabling us to fully optimize our systems for each application.
What you'll be doing:
Develop high-performance digital logic for data movement, I/O interfacing, networking and embedded signal processing
Develop high-performance HW interfacing software (drivers, libraries, etc) for FPGA / SoC platforms
Optimize algorithms across the HW and SW boundary
Architect our next generation of FPGA and SoC-based systems from concept to production
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple teams and mentor other developers
Deliver complex projects through incremental develop
What you must have:
5+ years of experience in software and/or digital logic design
Experience with Verilog or System Verilog
Experience with C or C++ for hardware interfacing
Experience interfacing FPGAs with one or more of the following: PCIe, AXI3/4, JESD204B, Ethernet, Camera Link, MIPI CSI-2
Experience with FPGAs in one or more of the following application areas: LIDAR, RADAR, image-processing, high-speed signal processing, networking, data movement
Experience with HDL simulators for IP and system level testing
Knowledge of and experience applying software best practices
Bonus points!
Experience with Linux kernel or other RTOS driver development
Experience with machine learning / AI on FPGAs
Experience with FPGAs in high-reliability applications
Experience with system level testing of SoC FPGAs

Lead a team of Functional Safety engineers to support all aspects of autonomous vehicle development across the company

About the role:
We are looking for an experienced safety and program management leader to lead our Safety Management System for Cruise that spans across all aspects of safety at the company including product development, workplace safety, and operations. In this position, you will collaborate with teams across Engineering, Operations, Product Safety, EHS, Hardware, HR, and Legal to build a world-class safety management system program in line with our company’s overall commitment to creating a safer world.
If you're interested in how to incorporate safety in the early stages of design and enable cutting edge technology development while making the world a better place, let's chat!
What you’ll be doing:
Ensure effective implementation of the Cruise Safety Management System including the four pillars of Safety Policy, Safety Risk Management, Safety Assurance, and Safety Promotion
Maintain and execute on detailed implementation and communications plans and track progress relative to SMS objectives
Design and conduct SMS trainings and be a champion of SMS and safety culture at Cruise
Proactively monitor and communicate SMS performance. Conduct formal periodic reviews of the SMS with executive leadership and present data in periodic safety meetings 
Oversee the implementation and administration of the SMS including SMS software-based tools for scale and efficiency. Manage and control SMS content to maintain simplified language and a user friendly experience. Manage the system functionality to ensure appropriate interfaces are  maintained and proper technologies are used to facilitate implementation. Ensure all SMS elements are aligned and function as an effective system within the broader Cruise design and operations workflows
Advance Cruise risk assessment standards and lead implementation of new or changing standards across the safety and systems engineering teams in Cruise
Develop, implement and maintain the SMS audit program including leading and/or coordinating with internal and external SMS audit teams 
Develop and maintain the governance for the SMS program, in consultation with Legal,  including document control, recordkeeping timelines, access, and workflows
Serve as the subject matter expert and represent the company to external stakeholders including regulatory officials and industry associations in all matters related to the Cruise SMS program 
What you must have:
Broad safety knowledge with 10+ years of leadership experience implementing and managing SMS in a transportation sector (AV’s, aviation, automotive, trucking, maritime, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with ability to provide clear recommendations and solutions
Familiarity with Systems Theoretic Process Analysis (STPA), Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), Functional Hazard Analysis (FHA), Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA), and System Safety Hazard Analysis (SHA).
Ability to negotiate and creatively problem solve for mutually successful outcomes with business leaders 
Ability to influence at all levels of management and formulate a compelling business case
Ability to manage through ambiguity and provide clarity to the team 
Results-driven with excellent project and program management skills
Stays current with safety & health industry trends, is a member of professional safety associations and has a strong network of safety professionals for best practice sharing
Ability to be agile, flexible, and adaptable to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and matrixed team environment
BA/BS or higher degree
Champion of safety culture
Bonus Points!
An advanced degree in safety, engineering, or related technical fields
Expertise in safety analysis and risk management for autonomous vehicles 
Experience working with the ICAO SMS framework
Statistics and data analysis experience
Experience with DOT, FMVSS, NHTSA

job-title: Senior Software Developer Engineer in Test - Embedded Systems
job-description:

We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.

Within Embedded Systems, we are hiring SDETs to support our component and integration testing teams. The component test team focuses on verifying low level requirements of specific modules, and the integration team works at the system level to verify that when components are integrated into a sub-system/system, everything functions as designed.
What you'll be doing:
Working with developers, systems engineers and product managers to create test plans, automated test cases, and tools for requirements verification and product validation
Working with software developers and hardware engineers to design and develop hardware in the loop (HIL) test platforms for autonomous vehicle components and subsystems
Designing creative test cases to verify, stress test, and break software running on the actual hardware
Finding, characterizing, and managing issues through resolution on hardware and in embedded software
Converting manual test cases to Python test cases on in-house test automation framework
Writing internal tools to help other developers and testers use the product
Communicating results to product owners and internal customers
Writing tools to post-process data from test automation and other tools as needed to support development
What you must have:
5+ years' experience in test automation on embedded systems
Experience with Python or other scripting languages
BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or another related field
Outstanding communication skills with team members
Outstanding written skills to define and document test system
Experience with automated test frameworks (e.g., Pytest, Robot Framework), Jira, svn/git, and Continuous Integration systems (e.g., Jenkins, CircleCI)
Experience in writing and executing verification plans for medical devices, aviation, automotive, or other safety critical applications
Bonus points!
Safety critical testing experience
GitHub and git experience
Experience developing in C, C++
Experience working with Jira

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.

The Autonomous Vehicle Systems team is responsible for deploying, running, and monitoring the Cruise software stack in all supported environments, whether it be on car or in testing frameworks. As a Senior AV Systems Software Engineer you’ll build tools to configure, instrument, deploy, and monitor Cruise software for use both in developer workflows and across our fleet. Your work will enable Cruise engineering to move quickly and reliably, as we evaluate, support, and deploy to new hardware and software configurations.
What you'll be doing:
Build tools to deploy, execute, and monitor AV code in development and production workflows
Build tools to configure Cruise software for use in a variety of configurations across simulation and hardware platforms
Integrate new platform revisions and hardware configurations into the system
Develop systems and frameworks to monitor vehicle HW/SW status and exfiltrate data
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple teams and mentor other developers
Deliver complex projects through incremental development
What you must have:

About the role: 
The Embedded OS team is dedicated to providing a high-performance platform for Cruise’s next generation of embedded devices. As a Senior Embedded Linux Software Engineer, you’ll be responsible for designing, documenting and implementing robust low level device firmware, bootloaders, kernel and application development environments, and APIs across a wide variety of devices and systems. Your work will enable Cruise to build a state-of-the-art autonomy platform, including sensors, controllers, and embedded compute platforms.
Day-to-day responsibilities include:
New board bring-up in collaboration with our Hardware R&D team
OS and kernel porting to new compute platforms
High performance driver development and tuning for networking, storage, data movement, and hardware I/O
Library, framework, and build system development to enable application software work
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple teams and mentor other developers
Effectively participate in team’s planning, code reviews, KPIs reviews, and design discussions leading to continuous improvements in these areas
Deliver complex projects through incremental develop
  You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
5+ years of experience writing production software, with an emphasis in the following areas:
Board bring-up for x86 or ARM Cortex-A based systems
Bootloader experience on the above platforms
Writing kernel drivers for: networking, I/O, storage or high-performance data movement
One or more of the following: Buildroot, Yocto, OpenEmbedded, OpenWRT
Experience with wired and wireless networking technologies including Ethernet, WiFi and wireless sensor networks
Knowledge about firmware security, secure communication, TLS and encryption/decryption
Knowledge of and experience applying software best practice
Bonus Points: 
Experience working with the following:
GPUs or other hardware accelerators
Linux kernel scheduling
Distributed systems
Multi-node NUMA or AMP systems
PCIe-based devices
ACPI or DeviceTree
Secure boot
QNX, VxWorks, or similar
GRUB, UEFI, U-Boot, or similar

Healthy lunch, snacks, dinner

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us. 
About the role: 
As a member of Cruise’s Future Compute Team, you will help blaze the trail for the rest of Cruise to develop, deploy and maintain high-performance and reliable Autonomous Vehicle (AV) software on the “next” generation of hardware architectures. You will work closely with hardware R&D and AV software teams (AI and robotics) to evaluate, simulate, and predict performance requirements for AV software workloads on future compute platforms. You will also help in integrating the AV software stack and novel sensor modalities onto these future compute platforms by solving performance critical issues and ensuring a reliable and robust platform bringup.
Day-to-day responsibilities include: 
Performance modeling and prediction of AV software stack performance on future compute platforms using performance models and simulators
Work with AV software teams to characterize AV workload and provide requirements to AV hardware teams
Prototype AV software stack  and software toolchains/SDK for future platforms
Analyze software architecture, identify algorithmic and architectural bottlenecks and collaborate with AV software teams to fix these bottlenecks
You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
Strong system fundamentals and coding abilities (C++)
Strong background in computer architecture
Solid understanding of how to design performance-critical software
Solid background in working with compute accelerators (e.g. GPUs), programming languages (e.g. CUDA, OpenCL), and general purpose parallel programming
Excellent interpersonal skills
Minimum 3+ years of relevant industry experience
MS or PhD in CS, or related technical field
Bonus points! 
Experience with Python or other scripting languages
Experience with real-time operating systems or software design
Experience with designing software applications for safety critical systems
Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, ONNX, PyTorch)
Experience with FPGA prototyping and emulation environments
Experience with performance tools (e.g. perf, vtune, nsight, eBPF)
Experience with performance modeling, simulation and analysis (TLM, cycle-accurate models, etc)
Experience with lower-levels of an accelerator software stack (i.e. drivers, runtimes, and user-level API) and the inter-layer interactions
Perks of being a Cruiser

Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life

Healthy lunch, snacks, dinner
Paid parental leave & family expansion stipend

On-site massages
State-of-the-art equipment for your work station

job-title: Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning Accelerator, GPU Programming
job-description:
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us. 
As a member of Cruise’s Machine Learning Accelerators (MLA) Team, you will help build the infrastructure for developing and maintaining a high-performant and reliable Autonomous Vehicle software. You will collaborate with other engineers to build systems, frameworks/libraries and automated processes to understand and solve performance critical issues, in a real-time safety-critical system. Specifically, this team is responsible for developing, delivering and maintaining low-level APIs and libraries of acceleration kernels optimized for MLAs. These library kernels are designed to be leveraged by application software (e.g., perception) to perform common sensor processing, math, data movement and MLA interfacing functions, with high performance and low runtime variation criteria in mind. The libraries will also provide cross-targetability to multiple MLAs (e.g., GPUs, DSPs, SIMD extensions, custom chips, etc). 
What you'll be doing: 
Define and lead the team’s vision and roadmap for software runtime optimizations
Design, develop and productionize library solutions and kernels that are reusable, retargetable, performance portable, and deterministic (minimum runtime variance)
Design, develop and productionize tools and methods for debugging and improving runtime performance of different AV software components and sub-systems
Lead cross-functional projects and initiatives for deploying library solutions across AV software stack, for improving software stability and efficiency
Collaborate with other engineering teams, to diagnose performance bottlenecks and design processes, workflows, and frameworks to improve diagnosis capabilities
Analyze the software architecture and help engineering teams convert algorithmic bottlenecks into specific software optimizations
Contribute to strategic hiring across the company. Able to become a Bar Raiser continuously raising the hiring bar for Cruise.
Provide mentorship and leverage the team’s fullest potential to achieve ambitious technical goals.
What you must have:
Solid background in working with data parallel accelerators (e.g. GPUs, SIMD extensions, etc) and languages (e.g. CUDA, OpenCL)
Strong system fundamentals and coding abilities (C++)
Strong background in computer architecture and operating systems
Solid understanding of how to design high-performant software systems
Experience leading and delivering high impact projects
Experience developing data- and thread-level parallel programs
Excellent interpersonal skills
Minimum 6+ years of relevant industry experience
Experience developing in a Linux environment
MS or PhD in CS, or related technical field
Bonus points! 
Experience with Python or other scripting languages
Experience with real-time operating systems or software design
Experience with designing software applications for safety critical systems

Competitive salary and benefits

job-title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning Platform
job-description:
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
About the role:
The Machine Learning Platform team builds and supports the essential tools and frameworks for every machine learning engineer at Cruise. Our goal is to greatly accelerate the development cycle of machine learning models across the whole company, empowering machine learning engineers to focus on improving the car’s safety and performance, instead of worrying about their infrastructure. Our scope covers the whole lifecycle of machine learning at Cruise: data processing, model training and deployment to vehicles. We are driven by the success of our partner teams who rely on our work to build the most advanced driverless cars in the world.
Day-to-day responsibilities include:
Design, implement and deploy backend systems and tools to support machine learning workflows at Cruise. Champion engineering excellence by continuously improving systems and processes.
Own technical projects from start to finish and be responsible for major technical decisions and tradeoffs. Effectively participate in team’s planning, code reviews and design discussions.
Consider the effects of projects across multiple teams and proactively manage conflicts. Work closely with partner teams to ensure they are benefiting from the systems we built.
Conduct technical interviews with well-calibrated standards and play an essential role in recruiting activities. Effectively onboard and mentor junior engineers and/or interns.
You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
Experience building scalable backend systems in service-oriented architectures and solving complex problems efficiently.
Experience working with relational databases or big data systems
Expertise with tools, systems and processes required to accomplish the job
Passionate about self-driving technology and its potential impact on the world
BS, MS or PhD in CS, Math, or equivalent real-world experience
3+ years of industry experience
Bonus points!
Fluency in writing in Python or JavaScript (React)
Experience in scalable data processing and warehousing systems, such as: Spark, BigQuery/Bigtable, Dataflow (Google Cloud), etc.
Experience with popular deep learning frameworks, such as: Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.
Even better if you understand: parallel training, active learning, model deployment (e.g., TensorRT conversion)
Experience working with Docker and Kubernetes
Knowledge and experience with machine learning algorithms.
Perks of being a Cruiser
While doing meaningful work is rewarding in itself, we also offer the following programs and benefits to support the extraordinary humans who serve as the backbone in making our self-driving cars go:
Competitive salary and benefits including 401(k) Cruise matching program to help you meet your long-term financial goals
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
Flexible vacation and company paid holidays
Healthy lunch, snacks, dinner
Paid parental leave & family expansion stipend
Monthly gym stipend
Quarterly offsites & working retreats
On-site massages
State-of-the-art equipment for your work station
Learn more about Life at Cruise through the lens of a Cruiser on our LinkedIn Page.
Cruise LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. And if you believe that you will need any type of accommodation, please let us know.

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us. 
The Maneuver Planning organization handles decision-making in urban environments, including collision avoidance, unprotected turns, four-way-stops, lane changes, going around double-parked vehicles, and more. Engineers on this team develop algorithms and systems for handling complex maneuvers and road scenarios, and work to write code that is clean, clear, efficient and reliable. We collaborate closely with the Prediction and Motion Planning teams to deliver robust, general solutions that capture the nuances of driving safely on the road.
Within Maneuver Planning, there are two teams you could work with: 
The Behaviors team is responsible for end-to-end maneuver performance. They drive projects to create new maneuvers and ways of representing behavioral decision making and scene interpretation. 
The Trajectory Planning team develops and improves core algorithms in order to accurately generate safe, comfortable, and human-like trajectories.  
Day-to-day responsibilities include:
Invent, extend, design and implement algorithms that inform how the self-driving car should safely and comfortably navigate thousands of complex scenarios a day in the dense, unstructured environments of San Francisco
Write reliable, scalable and high-performance software in C++
Test and validate your software through unit and integration tests, simulations, and analysis of on-road performance
Collaborate closely with members of adjacent teams on joint, high-impact projects 
Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative work environment where the immediate impact is a result of your efforts and where your contributions are highly visible
Embody Cruise behaviors: Stay Safe, Own It, Stay Focused, Seek Truth, Work Together, Be Humble
You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
3+ years of experience writing production code in modern C++
Experience implementing scalable and maintainable software design patterns
Strong organizational and communication skills
Bonus Points
Experience working in robotics or a similar field
Experience designing software applications for safety-critical systems
Experience developing real-time systems
Expertise in optimization theory or graph solving
Experience solving problems with computational geometry
CS. Degree

We’re Funded
GM, Honda, SoftBank, and T. Rowe Price have invested billions in Cruise. Their backing for our technology demonstrates their confidence in our progress, team, and vision and makes us one of the leading autonomous vehicle organizations in the industry. Our deep resources greatly accelerate our operating speed.

We have our own governance, board of directors, equity, and investors. Our independence allows us to not just work on the bleeding-edge of technology, but also define it.
We’re Vested
You won’t just own your work here, you’ll have the potential to own equity in Cruise, too. We are competing in a market that is projected to grow exponentially, which gives our company valuation room to grow.

About the role:
Cruise is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Replay Simulation team. This group takes on-road recorded sensor data and generates scenarios for our virtual world tests. The goal is to accurately predict which code branch/release will generate better on-road driving than others, all without driving the actual miles. In this role, you will leverage big data (gathering, synthesis, and analysis), machine learning, automation, simulation strategies, statistics, and experimentation. If you're looking for on an opportunity with direct impact on the delivery of sensor simulation systems of self-driving vehicles, join us!
What you'll be doing:
Extend our Simulation Driver architecture that controls our 2D and 3D simulation frameworks: NPC behaviors, path following, scenario parametrization
Write Technical Design Documents to describe architecture changes
Create authoring, helper and debugging tools
Develop test suites (unit, integration, system)
Partner with System Test Engineers to design and implement new features
What you must have:
BS in computer science or equivalent real-world experience
5+ years of experience writing clean, fast, reliable and highly scalable software
Proficiency in writing modern production code in Python.
Strong 3D math skills
Experience with RPCs (e.g. gRPC)
Natural ability to communicate well across teams of developers and other staff
Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative work environment where immediate impact is a result of your efforts and where your contribution is highly visible
Attention to detail and a passion for correctness
Bonus points!
3+ years experience with Unreal Engine 4 
UX experience in Unreal Engine Slate System 
Experience with modern C++
Experience in Simulations

As a software engineer on the Simulation Telemetry and Analytics team, you will build products and tools to evaluate and report on Cruise’s different Simulation frameworks and tools. About the role: 
The Simulation group delivers products that accelerate our autonomous vehicle development, testing, and deployment through specialized frameworks and tools.  As a Senior Systems Engineer on this team, you will define and drive systems requirements to enable and support Simulation’s infrastructure.  This role collaborates closely with customers and stakeholders to drive resolution of technical issues and solve complex problems in a cross-functional environment.
  Day-to-day responsibilities include:
Develop long-term and stable requirements, verification/validation, and/or software solutions to advanced problems.
Drive planning and execution by breaking complex products into projects and/or milestones that deliver incremental value to teams and customers.
Execute and iterate on requirements at all phases of development to ensure that requirements are implemented and tested within a timeframe that aligns with company needs.
Lead and communicate engineering analyses that provide teams with all the information needed to develop and continuously improve the systems function and performance.
Collaborate with Engineering Managers to ensure design, implementation, and programs are on track, and regularly drive consensus among diverse stakeholders on technical projects.
Prepare clear proposals and design documents for large-scope or cross-functional projects.

Experience in systems engineering, requirements management, software development, and validation/testing
5+ years experience in building tools for large, complex systems

Proven success in detail-oriented systems-level design and execution

BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, or equivalent experience
  Bonus points!
Experience in computer simulation, including video games and vehicle simulation software
Experience with fast-growth companies and recruiting/retaining the best talent

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
The Vehicle Controls team is responsible for the software and algorithms that makes the vehicle follow commanded reference trajectories in a safe, accurate, and reliable manner. This includes controller design and implementation (feedback and feedforward control) for reference tracking, state and parameter estimation, vehicle dynamics modeling, and fault detection/tolerance. Vehicle Controls lives between Motion Planning (responsible for generating comfortable, collision-free feasible trajectories) and Embedded Software (responsible for the hardware interface to the car’s actuators and sensors).
We are looking for a hands-on software engineering manager to lead, manage and grow an engineering team responsible for the Control Software that runs on our autonomous fleet. At Cruise, we believe in managers who remain deeply technical, and understand the challenges their teams are facing. The engineering manager will lead the technical direction of the team, mentor engineers and support career development, drive design decisions and code review, contribute hands-on to engineering development, and communicate team status and objectives with Senior management. 
What you'll be doing:
Lead the team’s efforts in extending the capability of Controls to cover more challenging driving scenarios and new vehicle platforms. 
Participate in design and code reviews.
Set up processes within the team to ensure high quality engineering architecture and design along with fast, reliable, testable production code
Work with Technical Project Managers and Senior Engineering Managers to develop and execute project roadmaps
Collaborate with recruiting to scale the team
Foster a collaborative culture of testing, safety, and documentation
Increase the productivity of the team by identifying process gaps, common pain points and scalability issues and develop a plan to address them
Work with GM and Cruise AV safety and validation teams on testing and requirements verification
Embody Cruise behaviors: Stay Safe, Own It, Stay Focused, Seek Truth, Work Together, Be Humble
What you must have:
Experience managing a software engineering team in a production environment
Prior experience as a software developer (C++)
Deep understanding of Linear and Nonlinear Control strategies and analysis tools
Practical knowledge of rigid body dynamics modeling and simulation
Bonus Points!
Knowledge of vehicle dynamics (suspension models, tire models, actuator and sensor models)
Familiarity with automotive or aerospace (or similar) safety critical systems and testing
Experience with autonomous vehicles or robot path planning
Familiarity with state and parameter estimation methods
Familiarity with Model Predictive Control (MPC)
Familiarity with automotive cruise control systems, ABS, traction control, stability control, etc. 
Experience with ROS
Experience in code optimization or high performance computing

Our Software Engineers working on Perception Quality are in charge of developing cutting edge methods to evaluate Autonomous Vehicle behavior. They own and build statistical tools that allow us to predict the behavior of Cruise in the next Release using a variety of simulation frameworks and on-road data. We drive programs across cross-functional stakeholders in engineering, data science, machine learning platform, and design to develop market-leading autonomous software evaluation strategy and repeatable testing workflows across Cruise AI.

Collaborate and communicate with others to concretely define and break up problems

Strong problem solving skills and data driven solutions
Experience automating test processes and writing test frameworks

job-title: Staff Applied Research Scientist, Computer Vision
job-description:
We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
Cruisers have the opportunity to define new ways of working and learn from world-class leaders in their field. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to play a part in making a positive impact in the world by advancing the revolutionary work of self-driving cars, join us.
What you'll be doing:
As a Staff Applied Research Scientist - Computer Vision, you drive the research projects that address the everyday challenges that happen on urban roads, ones that do not have standard solutions available. On a day-to-day basis, you will:
Formulate problems
Propose, prototype, evaluate, and iterate solutions
Support productizing and deploying solutions to robot cars
Initiate and lead new projects
Considered one of the technical leaders of the department who guides current and future technology choices
Have a deep understanding of the business and operational impact for different technology tradeoffs, and able to balance effectively based on company’s need
Enable others engineers on the team to be more effective through design and code that is easy to extend and contribute into
Capable of influencing others and building consensus even over contentious technical debates
What you must have:
PhD / MS degree in computer vision, machine learning or a related field with multiple research publications in top conferences or journals; alternatively equivalent years of industry experience solving CV problems which do not have readily-available solutions
Expertise in at least one of these specific areas: 2D/3D object detection, semantic / instance segmentation, fine-grained attribute understanding, human pose / gesture recognition, image sequence / semantics understanding, image embedding, visual/LIDAR-based tracking, multi-object tracking, and vision-based behavior prediction
Track record of driving ML research projects from start to completion, including conception, problem definition, experimentation, iteration, and finally publication or productization
Strong programming skills in Python and/or C++
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Bonus Points!
PhD in machine learning, computer vision, or robotics vision
Experience using deep-learning frameworks, e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc
Experience in deploying perception algorithms and models into real-world environments

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us. 
The Autonomous Vehicle (AV) software stack heavily relies on machine learning techniques to perform a variety of tasks, each with different requirements of hardware/compute resources. Throughout the life-cycle of each machine learning model, skilled ML engineers (on both training and inference sides) work closely to prepare it for a robust, scalable, and compute/power efficient inferencing on a resource-constrained hardware accelerator. Such a close working relationship is key to fast and successful deployment of intelligent systems on the car.
Cruise is looking for a deep learning compiler engineer to build the compiler and software tool chain for deploying machine learning models on to a variety of ML hardware accelerators. In this position, you will contribute, develop and enhance Cruise’s internal ML compiler infrastructure for high-performance and retargetability possibly by leveraging open-source technology like LLVM, TVM and XLA.
In this role, you will collaborate closely with engineers from different AV Engineering teams (e.g. Computer Vision, Perception, platform) to scope out system/software requirements at the application level while engaging with AV hardware teams to understand the target hardware platform and its constraints.
If you're interested in optimizing machine learning inference on different hardware accelerators, and want to test your skills with real-world (and practical) applications in the autonomous vehicle domain, let's chat!
What you'll be doing: 
Design, implement and test compiler features and capabilities related to IR infrastructure and compiler passes
Develop graph compiler optimizations like operator fusion, layout optimization, etc that are customized to each of the different ML accelerators in the system
Integrate open-source and vendor compiler technology in to Cruise’s internal compiler infrastructure
Build performance tooling to evaluate, understand and improve ML performance on different accelerators
Collaborate with cross functional agile teams of AV engineers to guide the direction of inferencing and provide requirements and feature requests for hardware vendors
Closely follow industry and academic developments in the ML compiler domain and provide performance guidelines and best practices for other ML engineers
What you must have:
5+ years of experience in the field of compiler design and 2+ years of experience with deep learning
Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, etc) and software stack (e.g., TensorRT, TVM, etc)
Experience with ML accelerators and hardware architecture
Strong expertise in writing production quality C++ code
Comfortable and experienced in software development lifecycle - coding, debugging, optimization, testing, integration
Familiarity with parallelization techniques for ML acceleration
MS, or higher degree, in CS/CE/EE, or equivalent, in industry experience
Bonus points!
GPU programming (CUDA) and familiarity with deep learning stack (e.g., cuDNN, cuBLAS)
SIMD programming (avx2, neon)
Experience with open-source deep learning stacks (TVM, XLA, etc)
Why Cruise?
