We are looking for a Staff Engineer to lead our software safety activities. In this position, you will develop and lead implementation of Cruise’s software safety strategies for the Autonomous Driving software and development tools needed to achieve our mission of superhuman driving performance. If you're interested in improving software safety while enabling nimble software development and quick iterations, let's chat!
What you’ll be doing:
Develop and formulate safety strategies for Cruise’s software development
Balance the needs of nimble software development and quick iterations with software safety requirements, tailoring the software safety approaches for different types and applications of software
Collaborate with software engineering team and safety team to develop standards, systems engineering tools, processes and procedures to implement software safety strategies
Adapt and adopt relevant safety standards and industry best practices to augment  Cruise’s internal software safety practices
Apply Functional Safety principles and framework as appropriate 
Lead the definition of software safety requirements, assess safety risks, oversee and perform hazard analyses, support software architecture design and analysis, and develop software safety validation strategies and hazard mitigation plans
Participate in software design and code reviews to enhance software safety -- direct coding is not required
Support software quality control, continuous integration, release and improvement processes
Develop the software safety case as part of the overall safety case for Cruise’s Autonomous Driving technologies and products
Advocate for software safety across all levels of the organization
What you must have:
Master's or Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field
10-20+ years of hands-on experience in software development, software verification and validation
10+ years of direct experience in System Safety engineering and software safety
Knowledge of Functional Safety (ISO26262) and its application in software
Expertise in safety analyses (e.g. Hazard and Risk Analysis, System-theoretic Process Analysis, Failure Modes and Effects Analysis, Fault Tree Analysis, etc.)
Proven track record of successes, e.g. having successfully managed software safety for safety-critical products and services
Ability to adapt industrial standards to new applications, but not be completely bound by them
Ability to apply simple principles to solve complex problems
Strong interpersonal skills to influence software development without owning it
Ability to articulate technical issues and solutions to all levels of the business, within and beyond the engineering communities
Bonus Points!
Direct experience in software safety for autonomous vehicles or automotive systems
Experience in mentoring and supporting junior engineers
Experience in safety incident investigation with regulatory bodies

job-description:

We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.

The Embedded Systems Test team is dedicated to building test coverage for all the embedded software and firmware that is part of the autonomous vehicle system developed by Cruise. We work closely with software development, hardware, and systems teams to achieve our goals.
What you'll be doing:
Work with developers, systems engineers and product managers to define testing and automation strategies that will impact the long term success of the Embedded Systems team.
Drive the definition of our automated test infrastructure.
Help the team to improve efficiency and efficacy of processes.
Mentor others and be a role model for the team.

10+ years experience defining tests and developing test automation 
Excellent python coding skills.
Experience with hardware in the loop testing
Experience applying and mentoring team members on software and test best practices
Capable of influencing others and building consensus even over contentious technical debates
Play a key role in others’ professional development, adding value to their career via improving their technical skills.

Experience developing in C, C++
GitHub and git experience
Experience with automated test frameworks (e.g., Pytest, Robot Framework), Jira, svn/git, and Continuous Integration systems (e.g., Jenkins, CircleCI)

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
The Frameworks Team
Frameworks team is responsible for the middleware that the AV software is built on. The AV Frameworks Team provides 
Products, tools and API that enable AV engineers to write high quality code in C++ & Python
Tools to measure and maintain code at that quality.
Userspace API, Memory management, pub/sub patterns
Thread prioritization, process/thread lifetime management
Performance tooling and optimization. 
What you’ll be doing:
Work with other teams to define the system level architecture and strategies for implementation.
Initiate large cross team projects with complex architecture, breaking it down to the right logical components and co-ordinate execution of the project with the TPMs/Managers 
Improve and deliver reliable software through requirements generation, design and code reviews, continuous integration, automated testing and issue tracking.
Work with management to drive the technical direction of the Frameworks Organization
Mentor junior engineers and be a role model for the team and organization.
Adopt, drive and encourage best practices within the team and the rest of the organization. 
What you must have:
Bachelor's degree in CS, or equivalent real world experience
10+ years of experience writing production-quality software
Experience with SOA or microservice-based architectures
Experience building performance critical systems in C++ 11 
Self motivation and passion to lead your teams, and constantly improve
Bonus Points!
Experience with modern C++14 / C++17 development
Experience working with ROS or other robotics frameworks
Experience with modern infrastructure technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
Experience working on or managing teams writing safety critical software
Experience with building frameworks / software infrastructure for large scale projects.
Experience in developing Autonomous Vehicle software. 
Perks of being a Cruiser
While doing meaningful work is rewarding in itself, we also offer the following programs and benefits to support the extraordinary humans who serve as the backbone in making our self-driving cars go:
Competitive salary and benefits including 401(k) Cruise matching program to help you meet your long-term financial goals
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
Flexible vacation and company paid holidays
Healthy lunch, snacks, dinner
Paid parental leave & family expansion stipend
Monthly gym stipend
Quarterly offsites & working retreats
On-site massages
State-of-the-art equipment for your work station

The Embedded OS team is dedicated to providing a high-performance platform for Cruise’s next generation of embedded devices. Your work will enable Cruise to build a state-of-the-art autonomy platform, including sensors, controllers, and embedded compute platforms.
What you'll be doing:
Work with other teams to define the system level architecture and strategies for implementation.
Initiate large projects with complex architecture, breaking it down to the right logical components so others can be utilized effectively.
Improve and deliver reliable software through requirements generation, continuous integration, automated testing, issue tracking, and code reviews
Mentor others and be a role model for the team.
What you must have:
10+ years of experience writing production-quality software
Board bring-up for x86 or ARM Cortex-A based systems
Bootloader experience on the above platforms
Writing kernel drivers for: networking, I/O, storage or high-performance data movement
One or more of the following: Buildroot, Yocto, OpenEmbedded, OpenWRT
Experience with wired and wireless networking technologies including Ethernet, WiFi and wireless sensor networks
Knowledge about firmware security, secure communication, TLS and encryption/decryption
Experience applying and mentoring team members on software best practices
Capable of influencing others and building consensus even over contentious technical debates

Experience with safety critical development (FDA, FAA, Automotive)
Experience with ROS or other robotics middleware platforms
Experience working with the following:
GPUs or other hardware accelerators
Linux kernel scheduling
Distributed systems
Multi-node NUMA or AMP systems
PCIe-based devices
ACPI or DeviceTree
Secure boot
QNX, VxWorks, or similar
GRUB, UEFI, U-Boot, or similar

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced self-driving vehicles to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving vehicles  will help save lives, reshape cities, give back time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
About the role:
We are looking for a talented Staff Software Engineer on the Ground Truth team to design and implement the technologies that enable Cruise’s Perception & Prediction teams to build their machine learning models and ultimately improve the safety of our self-driving cars. 
The systems and services the Ground Truth team owns cover a large portion of ML development lifecycle, all the way from data mining, data labeling, to automated model training and evaluation pipelines. We build sophisticated tools to discover what are the most relevant driving examples that will improve the performance of our ML models. We also build web-based data annotation systems and scalable data pipelines, used by our on-site and remote labeling teams, to ingest, manipulate, and annotate multidimensional, multimodal time series data to produce ground truth for machine learning training and validation purposes. In addition, we build highly automated pipelines to train and evaluate production-quality ML models in order to iteratively improve the quality of our ML datasets.
What you'll be doing:
Develop data mining tools to discover rare and/or challenging driving scenarios to enrich ML training and evaluation datasets.
Build web-based systems to annotate multidimensional, multimodal time series data and produce ML ground truth by leveraging both human and machine intelligence
Design and implement scalable pipelines to make ground truth data more accessible to ML engineers throughout the company
Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative work environment where the immediate impact is a result of your efforts and where your contribution is highly visible
Desire to be a complete team player by independently performing ad hoc duties, as they arise, outside of the main role in order to complete projects
What you must have:
7+ years of industry experience
BS, MS or PhD in CS, Math, Physics, or equivalent real-world experience
Experience managing projects across multiple teams
Experience working with relational databases
Experience building scalable APIs
Passionate about self-driving technology and its potential impact on the world
Attention to detail and a passion for correctness
Have a deep understanding of the business and operational impact for different technology tradeoffs
Considered one of the technical leaders of their company who guides technology choices
Bonus points! 
Working knowledge of applied machine learning and 3D geometry
Experience using ML software stack such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and KubeFlow
Experience writing in Go, ES6, Python, or similar
Experience working with frontend technology such as react and redux

The Planning team handles decision-making in urban environments, including collision avoidance, intelligent routing, unprotected turns, four-way-stops, lane changes, and more. Engineers on this team develop algorithms and systems for handling complex maneuvers and road scenarios, and work to write code that is clean, clear, fast and reliable.
We’re looking for a Staff Engineer on our Planning team to drive critical architecture decisions. The Planning team handles decision making in all urban road situations, including collision avoidance, intelligent routing, unprotected turns, four-way-stops, lane changes, and more. Our job is to produce robust, general solutions that capture all the nuances of driving safely on the road. Engineers on this team develop algorithms and systems for handling complex maneuvers and road scenarios and write code that is clean, clear, fast, and reliable.

Work with team leads and engineering leadership to prioritize development roadmaps and plan future projects

Bachelors/Masters/Ph.D. in Computer Science, Robotics, Mathematics, Physics, EE, or equivalent experience

Strong organizational and communication skills
Ability to clearly formulate, discuss, and solve novel problems
Eagerness to learn and explore new technologies
Bonus Points!
Experience developing high-quality software under significant latency and performance constraints (e.g. video games, high-frequency trading)
Motion planning and robotics experience

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.

At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.

The Integrated Systems team is looking for an experienced systems engineer who can lead the Integration strategy and requirements specification for embedded systems in the autonomous driving system. This position will be a great opportunity for someone with experience of existing concepts in automotive or other safety-critical applications integration strategy to apply their knowledge to the autonomous vehicle space.
What you'll be doing:
Drive discussions with SW, embedded, and HW engineering teams to develop the overall integration test strategy for ES projects at Cruise.
Generate integration requirements for the ES system that ensure functionality, performance and safety when individual components are integrated into the broader system.
Work with test engineers to create test plans and review test cases to validate system functionality, performance, and safety.
Work with upstream and downstream stakeholders to identify system needs, and drive alignment.
What you must have:
10+ years experience in Systems, Integration, or SW/HW engineering working on safety and time-critical products (automotive, aerospace, industrial, robotics, etc.) 
Specific knowledge of and experience with developing functional systems for these products
Knowledge of systems engineering principles including requirements analysis, decomposition/allocation and traceability, ConOps development, and top down thinking. 
Strong communicator who can proactively bring cross-functional teams together to get alignment.
Experience working with embedded SW and HW components including knowledge of common architectures for both.
Bonus points!
Automotive domain knowledge including ECUs, CAN, LIN, UDS, DTCs, DoIP, DoCAN, etc.
Previous experience working with Autonomous Vehicles.
Why Cruise?
Our benefits are here to support the whole you:
Competitive salary and benefits 
401(k) Cruise matching program 
Medical / dental / vision, AD+D and Life
Flexible vacation and company paid holidays
Healthy meals and snacks provided
Paid parental leave & family expansion stipend
Monthly wellness stipend
Commuter benefits
We’re Integrated
Through our partnerships with General Motors and Honda, we are the only self-driving company with fully integrated manufacturing at scale.
We’re Funded
GM, Honda, SoftBank, and T. Rowe Price have invested billions in Cruise. Their backing for our technology demonstrates their confidence in our progress, team, and vision and makes us one of the leading autonomous vehicle organizations in the industry. Our deep resources greatly accelerate our operating speed.
We’re Independent
We have our own governance, board of directors, equity, and investors. Our independence allows us to not just work on the bleeding-edge of technology, but also define it.
We’re Vested
You won’t just own your work here, you’ll have the potential to own equity in Cruise, too. We are competing in a market that is projected to grow exponentially, which gives our company valuation room to grow. 
Cruise LLC is an equal opportunity employer.  All applicants for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, genetics or any other legally protected basis.   Below, you have the opportunity to share your preferred gender pronouns, gender, ethnicity, and veteran status with Cruise to help us identify areas of improvement in our hiring and recruitment processes. Completion of these questions is entirely voluntary.  Any information you choose to provide will be kept confidential, and will not impact the hiring decision in any way.
We also consider for employment qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.  And, if you believe that you will need any type of accommodation, please let us know.

We’re Cruise, the self-driving ride-hailing service.
We are building the world’s most advanced, all-electric, self-driving cars to safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about. We believe self-driving cars will help save lives, reimagine cities, redefine time in transit, and restore freedom of movement for many.
At Cruise, our engineers have opportunities to grow and develop while learning from leaders at the cutting-edge of their fields. With a culture of internal mobility, there's opportunity to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges, see the results of your work in hundreds of self-driving cars, and make a positive impact in the world starting in our cities, join us.
About the role:
We are seeking a dynamic Systems Test Engineer to support the testing and quality assurance of our autonomous vehicles software planning sub-system as well as system level testing for the entire software stack. You will be responsible for creating tests in various simulation frameworks, reviewing test results to gate merge/release, comparing on-road and simulation results to understand testing gaps, training others on the creation and analysis of tests, and designing new test tools and improvements to existing tools.
An ideal candidate will have experience with systems level testing and validation on products that incorporate hardware and software. In this role you will be responsible for generating test programs and scripts. You will have a direct impact on Cruises’ future products by ensuring elite solutions to demanding test and engineering challenges.
  Responsibilities:
Release metrics and gating
Create and validate large test suites to cover our operational domain.
Repair/replace failing tests.  Devise methods to minimize future failures.
Coordinate effort to triage road failures, use triage results to understand & document the test gaps, and work with Simulation, Systems Engineering, and Data Science to close identified gaps.
Gate release to on-road testing using test results.
Work with Safety officer to develop evidence for public safety argument
Feature development
Create test strategies and test plans for new features.
Train users on test creation, execution, and analysis.
Review all tests that will be used to verify a feature.
Perform test analysis (including root causing failures) for new features.
Gate merge using test results and clearly documented analysis.
Framework improvement
Create detailed JIRA tickets against existing test frameworks and tools to address bugs and pain points; continually improve our testing capabilities.
Create design docs for new tools to increase our testing capabilities, working with Simulation, Systems Engineering, Data Science, and Data Analytics teams to ensure alignment.  Ensure these tools as implemented meet our needs.
Prototype test tools for future implementation in the production environment.
Organizational
Exhaustively document best practices.
Train and mentor other Systems Test Engineers.
Represent Systems Test in cross-functional teams
Requirements:
1-3 years of related root cause analysis experience or complex trouble shooting across multidisciplinary systems
Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to convince other organizations to address issues in a timely manner through thorough documentation and presentation.
Strong spatial comprehension and computational skills
Strong foundation in physics, motion control, and kinematics
Passionate about self-driving technology and its potential impact on the world
Minimum BS degree in electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer engineering, math, physics, or other relevant course of study

job-title: Data Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure & Analytics
job-description:
Who we are:
Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions. 
Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.
Meet the team:
The Machine Learning Infrastructure & Analytics (MLIA) team in Argo is responsible for delivering the platforms, tools, and services that power the ML workflows and Data Analysis needs of the organization. The Data Engineering sub-team of MLIA builds and maintains the data pipelines and software tooling that drive Ground Truth Labeling, ML Training, Data Science, and Data Analytics at Argo. The team is responsible for pipeline health, data quality, lineage, and data lifecycle management. In addition to pipeline development the team also performs Data Mining and Data Analysis services for its customers. The pipelines, tools, and services provided by Data Engineering are essential to the development of Machine Learning models by our Perception and Autonomy teams. This team is also responsible for data pipeline integration with our Analytics platform, which enables the creation of actionable insights from Argo’s data.
We are hiring experienced Data Engineers to help deliver the data, tools, and services that form the foundation of our ML and Analytics platforms. This is a high visibility role that will provide the opportunity to learn about, interact with, and add significant value to every part of our company supporting our goal of building safe and efficient self-driving vehicles.
What you’ll do: 
Work with stakeholders in the Perception, Autonomy, and Operations teams to define data requirements
Build scalable and efficient end to end data pipelines for our ML and Analytics platforms
Perform Data Mining and Data Analysis in support of client needs
Develop robust software tooling to manage data (Data Quality, Data Lifecycle Management, Lineage, etc.)
Work heavily with Python, C++, Spark, SQL, Airflow, and Looker 
Build ETL, deliver reporting, and perform data analysis needed by clients
Work with modern cloud, big data, and analytics technologies
Continually improve the quality, efficiency, and robustness of data pipelines and tooling at Argo
Help define and promote Data Engineering strategy and best practices
Participate in code and architectural reviews
Own initiatives from inception to implementation
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Strong team player that can collaborate effectively with others
Experience building highly scalable, reliable, and maintainable data systems
Experience building and working with ETL/ELT tooling
Experience working with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Hive, etc.)
Experience working with Data Warehouses (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.)
Experience working with Job Scheduling tools (Airflow, Luigi, Oozie)
Experience working with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Qlik, Looker, etc.)
Experience working with cloud infrastructure platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) 
Proficiency developing software with Python, and some development experience with C++ is required
Significant experience working with SQL and NoSQL database technologies
Strong presentation and communication skills 
What we offer you:
High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan with immediate vesting
Employer-paid group term life insurance and the option to elect voluntary life insurance 
Paid parental leave 
Paid medical leave
Unlimited vacation
Complimentary daily lunches, beverages, and snacks
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Monthly wellness stipend 
Professional development reimbursement
Employee assistance program
Discounted programs that include legal services, identity theft protection, pet insurance, and more
Company and team bonding outlets: employee resource groups, quarterly team activity stipend, and wellness initiatives
Our Background:
Argo AI was founded in late 2016 by industry experts with extensive experience building robotic systems for commercial applications. Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic partnerships with two of the world’s leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen. Our self-driving system is the first with commercial deployment plans for Europe and the U.S., and thanks to an ability to tap into both automakers’ global reach, our technology platform has the largest geographic deployment potential of any self-driving technology to date.
At Argo AI, we believe that embracing differences delivers superior results. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to an inclusive environment for all employees.

job-title: Lead Software Engineer, Big Data, Java/Python, Autonomous Vehicle Data Core
job-description:
Who we are:
Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions. 
Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.
Meet the team:
Building a self-driving vehicle requires gathering a huge amount of data. At Argo AI we have a fleet of cars driving on city streets and recording everything the car does into vehicle logs.  The Data Core team owns building the infrastructure to ingest into AWS and process petabytes of autonomous vehicle data. Skills in Python, Java, EMR/Spark and Terraform are highly relevant.

What you’ll do:
Lead the Data Core team of 5 to 7 developers to build Argo’s scalable data ingestion and processing systems.  This involves a mix of edge computing installed on vehicle depots and AWS based systems.
Be a key contributor to the team’s code base.
Own the teams architecture and be responsible for its implementation.
Develop proof of concepts and Architecture Designs.
Establish engineering best practices, and participate in code/architecture reviews.
Work closely with vehicle operation, autonomy integration, and development teams to identify key features to improve overall delivery of critical features to the AV.
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Robotics or a related field.
Deep experience with Python, Java, EMR/Spark, Linux, Terraform, and/or C++.
Great technical leadership and mentoring experience in leading a team of experienced software engineers.
Strong cross-team communication skills and very customer driven.
Experience with scaling cloud and on premise systems
Experience building highly available systems
Experience with gRPC and REST back-end services
Experience building and operating scalable data processing pipelines
Broad software development and architectural skills.
Expert level knowledge of cloud technologies including AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, and similar products
Excellent communication skills are required given our distributed and diverse team.

High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance

Employee assistance program

Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions.

Meet the team:
The Manufacturing Systems Software Engineering team at Argo AI is responsible for building, delivering, and supporting Argo's software releases to our engineering and manufacturing partners. You will be working with a highly cross-functional team of systems, software, and hardware engineers. As the lead for the Manufacturing Systems Software team, you will be responsible for managing and mentoring the team as well as providing technical leadership in the architecture, design, and delivery of software for Argo's self-driving systems.
What you'll do:
Manage and deliver software releases to our engineering and manufacturing partners.
Design and develop software processes and tools for manufacturing and test environments.
Support development of integration, testing, and validation software targeting a wide array of hardware platforms.
Responsible for personnel management tasks including hiring, goal planning, progress tracking, mentoring, reviewing employee performance, and team status reporting.
What we're looking for:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Strong leadership skills suitable for recruiting, leading, and managing a team of engineers to deliver high quality software.
Significant product development and manufacturing experience including the delivery of complex hardware and software products.
Experience delivering software to support hardware development life cycles (EVT, DVT, PVT).
Strong programming skills in at least one language such as C++ or Python.
Knowledge of software and associated frameworks in engineering/manufacturing environments for testing, verification/validation, change control, configuration/release management, etc.
Quantitative / analytical mindset to probe, test and decompose challenging system problems into root cause issues with strong, detail oriented skills to solve them.
Strong presentation and communication skills.
Prefer candidates with experience developing highly complex hardware systems in robotics, transportation, aerospace, consumer electronics, defense, medical, energy, or similar industries.
Open to travel to remote offices, test facilities, engineering partners, and manufacturing partners.

Our Background:
Argo AI was founded in late 2016 by industry experts with extensive experience building robotic systems for commercial applications. Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic partnerships with two of the world’s leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen. Our self-driving system is the first with commercial deployment plans for Europe and the U.S., and thanks to an ability to tap into both automakers’ global reach, our technology platform has the largest geographic deployment potential of any self-driving technology to date.
At Argo AI, we believe that embracing differences delivers superior results. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to an inclusive environment for all employees.

At Argo AI, we are working to transform the world of transportation by bringing fully autonomous self-driving cars safely into widespread use.  We already have some of the world’s most experienced leaders in the field, with expertise ranging from complex robotics algorithms to production software development to sophisticated hardware design and production.  We are looking for highly motivated, technically deep engineers and applied scientists to join our team and help us realize this vision.
Perception Lead:
Perception (tracking, detection) is a core technical problem for L4 self-driving vehicles and a key part of our autonomy stack. Self-driving cars need to track actors around the vehicle to make the correct decisions. The implementation must meet rigorous real time constraints and report stable tracks for the car to accurately identify the 3D state of the world. Ultimately, we must not only solve the algorithm challenges but produce safety-quality high performance software. So this position is as much a software challenge as it is a core algorithm challenge.
We are looking for hands on candidates who can set the vision for, grow and manage strong technical teams with a mixture of vision, probabilistic filtering and lidar algorithm experience and strong software experience. We are looking for a team lead who will be deep in code and is technically strong in software and (ideally) strong in tracking and detection algorithms -- segmentation, clustering, data association, multi-extended object tracking and filtering, MHT or other registration algorithms. Candidates need not have worked on self-driving or robotics applications. Candidates with extremely strong skills in some areas but weaker in others will be considered with a bias towards strong software engineering skills. The ideal candidate skill set includes:
Strong software engineering skills are required but we are language agnostic. A willingness to gain stronger software engineering knowledge and deep expertise in C++ and/or python is required.
Strong leadership skills suitable for recruiting, leading and managing a team of engineers to solve a challenging problem and build a critical component of a real-time system.
Strong theoretical and applied knowledge of relevant subsets of tracking-relevant algorithms.
Strong desire for candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms into the real world and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems.
Strong presentation and communication skills are desired.
ROLE DESCRIPTION:
As the lead for the perception team, you’ll be responsible for a critical piece of the system:
The component of the self driving vehicle keeping track in space and time of objects around the car.
Leading the team to advance the algorithmic performance through pragmatic and rigorous A vs B evaluations using a mix of state of the art or “classical” techniques
Ensure that the algorithms are integrated within our onboard infrastructure and hardware, are robustly implemented and run in real time
Coordinate with data collection to select and label relevant data to improve our tracking algorithms.
Manage 2 to 3 teams of ~5 engineers and researchers on each team.
  SKILLS, EXPERTISE, EDUCATION AND PRIOR EXPERIENCE:
Required Skills, Expertise, Education & Experience:
Experienced software engineer working on problems with advanced algorithms or researcher with a track record of real world applications involving solid software engineering.
Managed or tech lead small teams.
C++
Python
Real-time applications
Advanced probabilistic, machine learning or similar algorithms
Preferred or Desired Skills, Expertise, Education & Experience:
This is a role that involves building real time software, but also dealing with some technically and mathematically deep algorithms. While they don’t need to be the world’s expert on tracking, the candidate does need to be able to get up to speed quickly on the algorithm space and mathematical underpinnings and be able to hire candidates that are strong in probabilistic state estimation and registration as well as bring strong software engineering practice to bear.
Some subset of: Tracking, computer vision, SLAM, lidar, robotics, state estimation, machine learning, image or lidar registration.
Needs to be strongly familiar with probabilistic algorithms.
  At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others in small project teams, but can also be self-directed in independently pursuing broadly-scoped technical goals.
Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength. 
Benefits include:
Full, high quality health/dental/vision insurance.
401(k) plan with employer match.
Paid company holidays and extensive vacation.

Who we are:
Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions. 
Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.
Meet the team:
This team solves problems that involve geometric computer vision: processing sensor data from Lidar or imagery and geometrically reasoning about that data. That data gets used in localization to estimate pose relative to the map or, over time, calibration to produce high quality calibrations of the sensors and vehicle, and in mapping to geometrically align the world.
What you’ll do: 
Be able to manage multiple managers on teams including, Localization, Calibration, Special Projects and Lidar Processing.
Work on learning-based approaches to improve our visual localization and mapping system.
Set the vision for, grow and lead a variety of strong technical teams with a mix of vision and Lidar algorithm experience and strong software experience.
Work on geometric and learning-based approaches to improve our visual localization and mapping system
Be deep in code with strength in software and, ideally, localization algorithms (GCV, SFM, SLAM, or other registration algorithms).
Collaborate with engineers across a variety of teams to brainstorm and accelerate development of perception capabilities.
Design, implement and validate algorithms to support robust and scalable mapping pipelines for Argo’s self-driving cars. In addition, you will also design and implement necessary metrics and tools
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
A hands on candidate who can lead up to 10 people to solve these challenges
Strong fundamentals in geometric computer vision algorithms: pose estimation, numerical optimization, feature extraction, imagery and Lidar
Familiarity with IMUs and probabilistic state estimation methods
Ability to be deep into code and know how to drive a team to produce a high quality, runtime and a memory efficient, robust software product that can operate robustly under a range of real world conditions
Strong software, and software engineering skills are required but we are language agnostic. A willingness to gain stronger software engineering knowledge and deep expertise in C++ and/or python is required
Strong leadership skills suitable for recruiting, leading and managing small sets of teams of teams of engineers to solve a challenging problem and build a critical component of a real-time system
Strong theoretical and applied knowledge of relevant subsets of localization-relevant algorithms. These may include: SFM, pose estimation, model fitting, SLAM, complex state estimation
Strong desire for candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms into the real world and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems
Strong presentation and communication skills are desired
What we offer you:
High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan with immediate vesting
Employer-paid group term life insurance and the option to elect voluntary life insurance 
Paid parental leave 
Paid medical leave
Unlimited vacation
Complimentary daily lunches, beverages, and snacks
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Monthly wellness stipend 
Professional development reimbursement
Employee assistance program
Discounted programs that include legal services, identity theft protection, pet insurance, and more
Company and team bonding outlets: employee resource groups, quarterly team activity stipend, and wellness initiatives

Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic partnerships with two of the world’s leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen. Argo AI Cloud Platform engineers create reusable architecture patterns for cloud engineering via infrastructure as code for Argo teams to leverage as common shared components and educate Argo teams on how to architect their solutions for scale, security, and reviewed changes through automation. The Cloud Platform team interacts with engineering teams spanning from remote vehicle operations, ingest/data processing, mapping, labeling, triage, machine learning (detection, prediction, tracking), motion planning/control, offline simulation, and release/deployment teams to unify development practices and scalable efficiency of cloud/cloud native technologies

Meet the team:
Lidar-based sensing drives many of the technical approaches to challenges for L4 self-driving vehicles, and forms a key part of our autonomy stack. Self-driving cars can use Lidar data for localization, obstacle detection, and detecting actors in the environment. The implementation must meet rigorous real-time constraints while building rich models of the geometric state of the world. Ultimately, we must not only solve the algorithm challenges but produce safety-quality high performance software. This position requires both strong algorithmic fundamentals and solid software engineering skills.
What you’ll do:
Implement libraries, algorithms, and tools for processing Lidar data to push the state-of-the-art in obstacle detection, object tracking, and related perception challenges
Test and field these algorithms for real-time operation on autonomous vehicles at scale in challenging environments
Collaborate with engineers across a variety of teams to brainstorm and accelerate development of perception capabilities
Coordinate with data collection to select and label relevant data to improve our tracking algorithms and develop metrics by which the tracking system is evaluated
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Strong software engineering skills using C++ in real-time, computationally efficient systems are required. If the candidate is not already an expert in C++, a willingness to gain stronger software engineering knowledge in this language is required
Strong theoretical and applied knowledge of point cloud or Lidar based algorithms such as segmentation, localization, filtering, surface estimation/fitting, and interpolation/extrapolation
Theoretical knowledge of detection, segmentation, obstacle detection, graphical methods, probabilistic algorithms or optimization
Strong desire for candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms into the real world and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems
Strong presentation and communication skills are desired
Experience in Linux environments is desired

Design, implement and validate algorithms to support robust and scalable mapping pipelines for Argo’s self-driving cars. In addition, you will also design and implement necessary metrics and tools
Collaborate with engineers across teams to improve the maps. It requires not only how to build good maps, but also how the maps are consumed by different modules, so that sensible design decisions can be made

Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms and probability (in the context of mapping)
Solid understanding of analytic geometry, linear algebra and numerical optimization
Strong communication, problem-solving, task-prioritization and teamwork skills
Experience in geometric computer vision, point cloud processing or scene reconstruction is a plus
Experience in parallel or distributed computing is a plus

job-title: Senior Software Engineer, Motion Planning & Decision Making
job-description:
Who we are:
Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions. 
Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.
Meet the team:
The Argo AI Motion Planning team is the team that brings all of the autonomy inputs together. The team is responsible for taking perception, prediction, and mapping inputs and combining them to generate a safe, yet comfortable ride. This role will involve work on high-level decision making. This includes route planning, reasoning about lane geometry, intersections, traffic light decision making, lane changes, merging, other actors on the road (such as vehicles, pedestrians, bicyclists, etc.) among other things. Work by this team also involves taking these decisions and producing trajectories for the vehicle to drive.
What you'll do:
Design and develop algorithms throughout the Motion Planning stack, which could include things ranging from route planning, trajectory optimization, decision making, and even some ride comfort work.
Test and debug algorithms and code being ran on the vehicle.  Including:
Simulation testing
Log playback and resim
Cloud simulation
On vehicle testing
Work with other teams to ensure capabilities align with Motion Planning needs. 
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Strong theoretical and applied skills in subsets of Motion Planning: Motion/trajectory planning and route planning applied to land, air, space, or water-based robots such as behavioral planning, shortest path, obstacle avoidance, A*, D*, lattice, and RRT to name a few
Hands on experience with real platforms and with an intimate understanding of the challenges of working with complex systems and a quantitative/data driven approach to improve system performance
Experience building systems that must convey intent as well as making optimal decisions and/or interact with humans on a regular basis, preferred
Strong software skills are required but we are language agnostic. A willingness to gain stronger software engineering knowledge and deep expertise in C++ and some python is required
Strong presentation and communication skills are desired
What we offer you:
High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan with immediate vesting
Employer-paid group term life insurance and the option to elect voluntary life insurance 
Paid parental leave 
Paid medical leave
Unlimited vacation
Complimentary daily lunches, beverages, and snacks
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Monthly wellness stipend 
Professional development reimbursement
Employee assistance program
Discounted programs that include legal services, identity theft protection, pet insurance, and more
Company and team bonding outlets: employee resource groups, quarterly team activity stipend, and wellness initiatives

Who we are:
Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions. 
Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.
Meet the team:  
The Motion Controls team at Argo is responsible for selecting steering / powertrain / brake requests in order to pilot the autonomous vehicle safely and comfortably to its destination.  To do so, we build and maintain vehicle dynamics models and design algorithms to leverage these models for accurate vehicle planning and control. We split our time between designing/implementing algorithms, and testing/experimenting and analyzing data. Our work is not done until it works in the car!  
What you’ll do: 
Develop efficient and well tested software in C++ and Python for the Motion Control systems of the autonomous vehicle;
Design metrics to measure software performance, implementing automated metric extraction tools;
Design and implement debugging visualization to aid in algorithm testing and troubleshooting;
Test performance of software features in-vehicle and off-board on fleet collected data;
Refactor legacy software to adhere to modern design principles and best practices; and
Audit the Motion Control software to recommend large scale refactors that improve runtime efficiency.
What you'll need to succeed:
Master of Science degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field of study together with two (2) years of experience in a related occupation. 
Will also accept a Bachelor of Science degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field of study together with four (4) years of experience in a related occupation. 
Previous employment experience must have included: 
At least two (2) years of experience in developing  software for real platforms and complex systems using C++ and/or Python;
Experience in using quantitative and data driven approaches to improve software system performance;
Experience with developing algorithms for Planning & Controls systems, including motion / trajectory planning, vehicle modeling, vehicle control, and route planning applied to robots; and
Experience in designing real time data visualization to aid in algorithm debugging.

High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance

What you’ll do: 
Be a part of building a virtual world to allow us to iterate quickly, test safely before getting to a car, and to get enough virtual miles to help build our safety case

Argo AI Site Reliability Engineers are responsible for building and running our mission-critical systems. Through the implementation of monitoring and automation, our SREs constantly ensure the health, reliability, scalability, and performance of Argo AI’s infrastructure. The Site Reliability team works together with engineering teams, IT, and Security to address unique business challenges through comprehensive solutions while taking into account system uptime, reliability, and maintainability. Design and implement scalable distributed systems to facilitate the development of self-driving vehicles
Monitor and maintain mission-critical production services to ensure maximum uptime
Document actions to build a comprehensive library of runbooks, which will act as a knowledge base and foundation for automation
Scale the reliability and velocity of our systems and processes through increased automation
Participate in an on-call rotation and culture of continuous improvement through blameless postmortems

Strong experience scaling and securing services in the cloud (AWS, GCP) or cloud native environments

If you are unsure the best role for you based on our current postings or there is no role currently posted that matches your skills and experience, we encourage you to apply to this role. We will contact you if we find a role that would be a good fit for you. 
We need highly motivated, talented C++ software engineers to join our team and help us realize this vision. C++ is our core programming language for on-vehicle software and thus is critically important to our team.

Who we are:
Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s largest automakers, we’re building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions. 
Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.
Meet the team: 
  Machine learning, more specifically deep learning algorithms (detection, segmentation, and fusion tasks) are one of the main challenges for self-driving vehicles and a key part of our autonomy stack. Self-driving cars need to perceive objects and actors around the vehicle to make the correct decisions. The implementation must meet rigorous real time constraints and reliably report detections in 2D or 3D spaces. Ultimately, we must not only solve the algorithm challenges but produce safety-quality high performance software. So this position is as much a software challenge as it is a core algorithm challenge.
  We are seeking hands on candidates who have a mix of computer vision, machine learning expertise, embedded and real time constraints and low level accelerators (FPGA, GPUs). We are looking for practitioners who will be deep in code, and are technically strong in software and (ideally) strong in applied machine learning algorithms. Candidates need not have worked on self-driving, or robotics applications. Candidates with extremely strong skills in some areas but weaker in others will be considered with a bias towards strong software engineering skills.
What you’ll do:
Core models used for scene understanding that are front and center in the perception pipeline
Research projects improving not only our current image space but also radar, LiDar space detection algorithms and best methods to fuse together to improve performance
Turning algorithm exploration that performs best on rigorous and pragmatic A vs B experiments evaluated extensively on data into models/software running on the vehicle
Working with data collection to select and label relevant data to improve our supervised training
Working with label tooling team to adjust labeling policies, and approaches to obtain the best label set needed
What we're looking for:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Strong software engineering skills are required but we are language agnostic
A willingness to gain stronger software engineering knowledge and deep expertise in C++ and/or python is required
Strong theoretical and applied knowledge of relevant subsets of detection algorithms
Strong desire for candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms into the real world and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems
Experienced software engineer or research with a track record of real world applications incorporating machine learning and computer vision
Python
C++
Realtime applications
Experience with real world applications of machine learning and computer vision
Classification, scene understanding, object detection classes of algorithms
Familiarity with Mxnet, caffe, tensorflow or other similar deep net or machine learning packages
GPU expertise

High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages

Meet the team: 
The Embedded Software Engineering team at Argo AI is responsible for developing and validating a broad array of safety critical code for our sensor and computer systems. Embedded Software Engineers work with cross functional teams to develop the requirements and software architecture for our embedded systems. They write and test software for microcontrollers and system-on-chip (SoC) devices in the vehicle. And they conduct system integration validation testing with their peers.
What you’ll do:
Deliver RTOS solutions for safety critical embedded software in a robotics + automotive environment.
Design software for sensor control, inter processor communications, monitoring, drivers, acceptance testing, and more.
Work with other Hardware Engineers to define requirements for hardware systems.
Work with other Software Engineers to integrate embedded systems into Argo AI’s autonomy software stack.
What we're looking for:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experience in software development for embedded devices
Experience in Low Level Communications Protocols
Experience in Bare Metal Product Environments
Strong C/C++ programming skills applied to embedded Microcontroller/Microprocessor targets
Experience in Memory Constrained Environments
Ability to understand PCB schematic and layout documents
Experience with debugging tools and methods for embedded targets
Quantitative / analytic mindset to probe, test and decompose challenging system problems into root cause issues with strong, detail oriented skills to solve them
A record of owning projects successfully and working in a fast paced environment
Ability to serve cross functional roles in a young company
Good experience writing concise, clear, and detailed engineering documentation
Strong presentation and communication skills
Experience with communication protocols used in embedded, robotics and automotive industries
Prefer candidates with experience developing highly complex hardware systems in robotics, transportation, aerospace, consumer electronics, defense, medical, energy, or similar industries
Open to occasional travel to remote offices, test facilities, engineering partners, or manufacturing partners

Our deployment team creates the software responsible for getting the bits onto the vehicles in a timely and efficient manner, as well as providing the fleet operations team with the additional tooling required for maximizing their testing capabilities. As a member of the deployment team, you’ll have a front-row seat to the future of autonomous vehicles and play a critical role in moving humanity into the next era of safe and reliable transportation.

Build the next generation of deployment software and tooling for deploying our autonomy stack to cars and data centers
Leverage your in-depth knowledge of computing hardware and software to squeeze the most out of the onboard embedded compute system
Grow your software development skills by working side by side with some of the most talented and experienced engineers in the world

Meet the team:
The Radar Software Engineering role supports the entire radar pipeline from characterizing the physical characteristics of different radars to algorithmic development to make autonomous vehicles smarter & safer under various challenging scenarios, e.g., poor lighting, severe weather, long distance, etc. Moreover, the candidate will work deeply with the rest of the tracking team to fuse radar data with other sensory modalities to ensure the perception system generates a precise, temporally consistent representation of the environment.
What you’ll do: 
Radar is critical to autonomous driving. You will develop core algorithm and software modules for the radar pipeline, from frontend raw data processing to backend fusion with other sensor modalities.
Your work will be essential to fielding these vehicles and you will have direct exposure to real world data and feedback, and the satisfaction of having contributed to a state-of-the art autonomous vehicle.
You will be part of a broader perception team and will participate in discussions and brainstorming.
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Robotics or a related field (MSc/PhD preferred).
Knowledgeable in areas pertaining to radar: signal processing, range/Doppler/angle estimation, ambiguity function, undersampling, multipath modeling, frequency modulation, radio interference mitigation, data filtering, time synchronization, etc.
Hand-on experience on automotive radar data analysis, e.g., radar data interpretation, outlier analysis & removal, data uncertainty modeling, false alarm detection, radar data labelling, system diagnostics, etc.
Experience on sensor fusion, e.g., robust state estimation and tracking ( EKF, UKF, PF), data association, numerical optimization techniques, 2D/3D geometry, robotics, etc.
Knowledge of the advantages and limitations of each sensor modality used by autonomous vehicles.
Strong software engineering skills. Experience with C++ is required and modern C++ knowledge is strongly desired.
Significant experience optimizing code to be both compute and memory efficient.
Experience with software system architecture design, particularly for real-time applications.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.
Experience in Linux environments is desired.
Experience developing, and evaluating real time radar tracking systems.

High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance

Prediction is a core technical problem for L4 self-driving vehicles and a key part of our autonomy stack. For a self-driving vehicle to navigate the world safely and efficiently, it needs to reliably infer the underlying intent of other objects (such as vehicles, pedestrians, bicyclists) by analyzing the perception data. Fundamentally, this is a machine learning problem involving multiple interacting agents subject to real-time performance constraints. We are looking for candidates with deep machine learning expertise that have built and deployed software systems to solve real world problems. Candidates need not have worked on self-driving, or robotics applications.
What you’ll do:
Responsible for the component of the self driving vehicle software stack to forecast what other objects in the scene will do in conjunction with the AV
Leading the team to advance the algorithmic performance through pragmatic and rigorous A vs B evaluations using a mix of state of the art and established techniques
Ensure that the algorithms are integrated within our onboard infrastructure and hardware, are robustly implemented and run in real time
Coordinate with offboard teams to select and label relevant data to improve our prediction algorithms and develop metrics by which the prediction system is evaluated
Manage a team of ~10 engineers and researchers
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experienced software engineer working on problems with advanced algorithms or researcher with a track record of real world applications involving solid software engineering
Strong theoretical knowledge in machine learning (both classical and deep learning)
Preference for candidates with experience in techniques used for behavior analysis, activity recognition, intent prediction, time series forecasting and multi-agent interactions
Proven applied machine learning skills to solve real world problems and deal with real world data
Candidates should know how to manage datasets, analyze models and know how to improve performance through targeted data collection, data mining and/or labeling
Strong desire for candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms into the real world and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems
Proven track record of leading small teams on highly challenging machine learning problems to solve real world applications
Knows how to recruit top software engineering talent
Knows how to recruit top machine learning talent
Knows how to manage and lead a strong engineering team
Has experience with all key aspects of attracting and maintaining a strong technical team 
Knows how to work programs with aggressive schedules, how to mitigate risks while still making large technical advances

Our Background:
Argo AI was founded in late 2016 by industry experts with extensive experience building robotic systems for commercial applications. Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic partnerships with two of the world’s leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen. Our self-driving system is the first with commercial deployment plans for Europe and the U.S., and thanks to an ability to tap into both automakers’ global reach, our technology platform has the largest geographic deployment potential of any self-driving technology to date.

Meet the team:
Tracking is a core technical problem for L4 self-driving vehicles and a key part of our autonomy stack. Self-driving cars need to track actors and estimate velocities around the vehicle to enable rapid and accurate decision making. The implementation must meet rigorous real-time constraints and report stable tracks for the car to accurately identify the 3D state of the world. Ultimately, we must not only solve the algorithm challenges but produce safety-quality high performance software. So this position is as much a software challenge as it is a core algorithm challenge.
We are looking for hands on candidates who can set the vision for, grow, and lead a strong technical team with a mix of vision, probabilistic filtering and LiDAR algorithm experience and strong software experience. We are looking for a team lead who will be deep in code, and is technically strong in software and strong in tracking algorithms -- segmentation, clustering, data association, multi-extended object tracking and filtering, MHT or other registration algorithms. Candidates need not have worked on self-driving, or robotics applications. 
What you’ll do:
Responsible for the component of the self driving vehicle keeping track in space and time of objects around the car and estimating their velocities
Leading the team to advance the algorithmic performance through pragmatic and rigorous A vs B evaluations using a mix of state of the art or “classical” techniques
Ensure that the algorithms are integrated within our onboard infrastructure and hardware, are robustly implemented and run in real time
Coordinate with data collection to select and label relevant data to improve our tracking algorithms and develop metrics by which the tracking system is evaluated
Manage a team of ~7 engineers and researchers
What you'll need to succeed:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experienced software engineer working on problems with advanced algorithms or researcher with a track record of real world applications involving solid software engineering
Managed or tech lead small teams
Strong theoretical and practical applied knowledge of relevant subsets of tracking-relevant algorithms is required
Strong software engineering skills using C++ are required. If the candidate is not already an expert in C++, a willingness to gain stronger software engineering knowledge in this language is required
Strong leadership skills suitable for recruiting, leading and managing a team of engineers to solve a challenging problem and build a critical component of a real-time system
We are building a product, so candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems are highly desired
Strong presentation and communication skills are desired
Managed or tech lead small teams
Real-time applications
Kalman Filtering
Image or LIDAR-based Tracking
Multiple Object Tracking
